page.title: 06HOUSING-YALDING,NETTLESTEAD
page.content: Typical English villages, Nettlestead and Yalding have a mixed population, some well-off people, some relatively poor people (but none terribly poor) and many in between. Yalding has two private estates, Oast Court and the Downs Farm estate. Both Nettlestead and Yalding contain more Council-owned houses than is usual in villages, Nettlestead having Bryants Close and Bishops Close and Yalding's include Medway Avenue and others not in this block. The Nook is a Council development for elderly people with a warden. Several former Council tenants are purchasing their houses. A typical family home has 3 rooms downstairs and 3 rooms and a bathroom upstairs. Perhaps untypically, many local houses have no garages on site though they may be available.
